page.title: 06E. CHARMINSTER - RECREATION
page.content: There are no organised facilities for recreation within this section of the parish, other than those based on rural pursuits. The Riding School situated at New Buildings has fourteen horses. There is an enclosed training area, although riders also make use of the many bridleways in the surrounding countryside. The school also offers livery facilities to horse owners. They are fortunate in having the use of a natural water bore hole on their land. Several small copses within the area house pheasant hatcheries, and{shoots} in season make use of the land, which also supports the South Dorset Hunt. The eastern side of the parish is greatly enjoyed by walkers, who make full use of the network of footpaths. Views are extensive in all directions.
